revised_title: Evan James Williams: A Life in Physics
tldr: Evan James Williams was a talented physicist who made significant contributions to experimental and theoretical physics. He worked with notable scientists like Niels Bohr and Ernest Rutherford, and held positions at several prestigious institutions. Williams was known for his ability to analyze complex physical processes with a minimum of mathematical analysis and a maximum of physical understanding. He made important contributions to the U-boat war during World War II, and his work in radar and tactical analysis helped in the winning of the campaign.
